oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cynthia Dunn
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographic portrait of Cynthia Dunn, Captain of the Blount County Women's Home Guards during the Civil War. She has dark hair and is wearing a scarf.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women; Militias

United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Women; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Participation, Female; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Blount County Women's Home Guards made their flag from their petticoats. The flag was kept at Maryville College for a number of years but is now lost.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection
